parsed.internal_thinking: As the first player to place, I need to secure a high-yield node that provides the essential resources for early expansion: Brick, Wood, and Sheep. After analyzing the board, Node 20 stands out as the strongest overall starting position. It connects to Hex 9 (Wood 11, 2 pips), Hex 5 (Brick 6, 5 pips), and Hex 4 (Sheep 8, 5 pips), totaling 12 pips. Securing the 6-Brick is particularly advantageous since Brick is often a bottleneck for building roads and settlements. While Node 43 offers a higher total pip count (13), it is heavily skewed toward Wheat (9, 6, 9), which lacks the diversity needed for early growth. Node 42 (12 pips of Wheat and Ore) is another strong option, but Node 20's balance of building materials makes it the superior choice for a first settlement. I'll aim to pick up Wheat and Ore with my second placement. [Response was too brief]
parsed.note_to_self: Started at Node 20 (W11, B6, S8). In the second round of setup, I need to prioritize Wheat and Ore to ensure I can build cities and buy development cards. I'll keep an eye on Node 42 and Node 43, though they are likely to be taken.
parsed.say_outloud: I'll start by taking the 6-8-11 spot at node 20. It's a great balanced location with the best brick on the board. Good luck, everyone!
